clusters.title: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport
clusters.neutral_headline: Rex Flight Evacuated After Engine Fire at Adelaide Airport

items.title: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport
items.standfirst: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.
items.content: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.

items.title: 'Heart was jumping out of my chest ': Passengers look out window to see plane on fire
items.standfirst: A mechanical fault caused a plane engine to catch fire just moments after take-off, leading to operations at Adelaide Airport being temporarily shut down.
items.content: A mechanical fault caused a plane engine to catch fire just moments after take-off, leading to operations at Adelaide Airport being temporarily shut down.The Rex Airlines flight on the runway and was bound for Broken Hill just after 7am when the pilot braked and abandoned take-off. Passengers then spotted flames coming from the engine. READ MORE: 'Could be the end': Surfer who survived shark attack relives shocking incident"The plane started to brake just before we rotated, and I thought 'oh that's not good', and then someone started yelling out 'fire, fire', and I thought 'oh that's not good either'," passenger Warwick Beverley said. Beverley and his fiancé Sandy Holmes were desperate to head home after his emergency brain surgery to remove a tumour in Adelaide.Today, they were left with "another story to tell". Passengers and staff were ushered off the aircraft, and a bus picked them up from the airport and took them back to the terminal, where they were booked on another flight.The fire self-extinguished. READ MORE: What we know about the latest uni cybersecurity breach - and how to protect yourself"I'm glad it wasn't in the air," Holmes said. "I hate flying anyway so I had to really tell myself I was on the riverbank because my heart was jumping out of my chest ."The situation impacted operations across the entire airport, with the runway closed for about 30 minutes before reopening about 8am. Rex Airlines claims a small amount of unburnt fuel ignited in the engine's exhaust, causing the emergency. The Australian Transport Safety Bureau is investigating the mechanical fault.DOWNLOAD THE 9NEWS APP: Stay across all the latest in breaking news, sport, politics and the weather via our news app and get notifications sent straight to your smartphone. Available on the Apple App Store and Google Play.

ai_summary: A Rex aircraft experienced an engine fire shortly after taking off.
The incident led to the evacuation of passengers at Adelaide Airport.
Operations at Adelaide Airport were temporarily shut down.
Passengers praised the pilot and cabin crew for their actions.
The fire was caused by a mechanical fault in the engine.

items.standfirst: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.
items.content: Students have been left with HECS debts and careers that are "non-existent" after completing degrees that were not accredited. Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.

ai_summary: Graduates completed university degrees that were not accredited.
Students are now facing HECS debts and limited career options.
Class actions have been launched against two Australian universities.
The lack of accreditation has impacted graduates' employment prospects.
The universities are facing legal challenges from affected students.
